casebody.data:
DAWN BIBLE STUDENTS ASSOCIATION, A CORPORATION OF NEW JERSEY, PLAINTIFF-RESPONDENT, v. THE BOROUGH OF RUTHERFORD, A MUNICIPAL CORPORATION OF NEW JERSEY, DEFENDANT-APPELLANT. Superior Court of New Jersey Appellate Division Argued March 21, 1949 Decided April 6, 1949.

Before Judges McGeehan, Donges and Colie.

Mr. Oliver T. Somerville argued the cause for the appellant. Mr. George A. Smith (Messrs. Conkling, Smith & Towe, attorneys) argued the cause for the respondent. Per Curiam.

Except for the fact that the property of the-plaintiff taxpayer is in the Borough of Rutherford and a difference in the amount of the assessment, this case is controlled by the decision of the court filed this day in the case of Dawn. Bible Students Association v. Borough of East Rutherford, 2 N. J. Super. 71.

The judgment under review is reversed.
